pages.title: ℧ King of Cups ℧
pages.text: King of the Chariot of Waters$(br)       $(m)∆$() Air of ∇ Water

The King of Cups sits on a large stone throne set upon the sea.$(br)  In his right hand he holds a cup, and his left has a scepter showing power and control.$(br)  He doesn't look at his cup and seems to be focused elsewhere; as if his awareness has moved down into the unconscious.$(br)  Calm and balanced, even in turbulent conditions, he has learned how to sail his emotions and unconscious

impulses, without getting lost in them.$(br)  The King of Cups is a master of emotions and of the inner life. Often this mastery can mean that he suppresses, or submerges, some feelings, lest he falls in the waves.$(br)  Another interpretation would see him as a true dweller within the imagination, not distracted by outer events; concerned more with his own contemplations than any need to share with others.

$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Law, art and science; creative intelligence.$(br)  May symbolize a dreamer, someone with a deep inner life; they are very calm, but this may conceal more difficult emotions.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Dishonesty, injustice, vice, loss.$(br)  Something disturbs a person's outer tranquility.$(br)  Can mean someone becoming very emotional.
